task.title: Changing the local Docker registry endpoint

taskbody.context:
Use this procedure to configure the delegate host with the endpoint of the local Docker registry. Unless the master host is configured with an alternative local Docker registry, which is rare, the endpoint is the master host's hostname or IP address and port 5000.
The following configuration variable identifies the local Docker registry endpoint:
Perform these steps:

step.cmd: Log in to the delegate host .

substep.cmd: Locate the line for the SERVICED_DOCKER_REGISTRY variable, and then make a copy of the line, immediately below the original.
Replace localhost:5000 with the endpoint of the local Docker registry.
substep.info: If the master host is configured with an alternative local Docker registry, use the same endpoint here. Otherwise, just replace localhost with the IP address or hostname of the master host.

step.cmd: Add the insecure registry flag to the Docker configuration file.

substep.cmd: Add the local Docker registry endpoint to the end of the OPTIONS declaration.
substep.stepxmp: Replace Registry-Endpoint with the same value used for the SERVICED_DOCKER_REGISTRY variable: --insecure-registry=Registry-Endpoint

info.note: Use a space character ( ) to separate flags, and make sure the double quote character (") delimits the declaration of OPTIONS.
